intro: Lactuca persica, commonly known as Persian lettuce, is a leafy green plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It features elongated, pale green leaves with a mild, slightly peppery flavor. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a short, stout stem. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its edible leaves. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other flowering plants.
